snippet: Research comparing the genetic signatures of Lyme bacteria in people who had the disease more than once challenges the notion that it has a tendency to turn into a chronic illness.
abstract: Study published in The New England Journal of Medicine finds that repeat symptoms of Lyme disease are from new infections, not relapses; results challenge strongly held notion that Lyme disease, bacterial infection, has tendency to resist usual antibiotic treatment and turn into chronic illness that requires months or years of antibiotic therapy.
lead_paragraph: Research comparing the genetic signatures of Lyme bacteria in people who had the disease more than once challenges the notion that it has a tendency to turn into a chronic illness.

headline.seo: Recurring Lyme Disease Symptoms Caused by New Infection, Study Finds
headline.main: New Infection, Not Relapse, Brings Back Lyme Symptoms, Study Says
headline.print_headline: New Infection, Not Relapse, Brings Back Lyme Symptoms, Study Says
